SecretArn.description: The ARN for the secret created for the connection.

Arn.description: The ARN of the connection that was created by the request.

ArnForPolicy.description:
Returns the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a connection in resource format, so it can be used in the `Resource` element of IAM permission policy statements. For more information, see [Resource types defined by Amazon EventBridge](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/service-authorization/latest/reference/list_amazoneventbridge.html#amazoneventbridge-resources-for-iam-policies) in the *Service Authorization Reference* .

For example, the following resource defines an IAM policy that grants permission to update a specific connection.

`Resources: ExamplePolicy: Type: AWS::IAM::Policy Properties: PolicyName: ExamplePolicy PolicyDocument: Version: '2012-10-17 ' Statement: - Effect: Allow Action: - events:UpdateConnection Resource: - !GetAtt myConnection.ArnForPolicy`

AuthParameters.ConnectivityParameters.Re.description:
For connections to private APIs, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource association EventBridge created between the connection and the private API's resource configuration.

> The value of this property is set by EventBridge . Any value you specify in your template is ignored.

InvocationConnectivityParameters.Resourc.description:
For connections to private APIs, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource association EventBridge created between the connection and the private API's resource configuration.

> The value of this property is set by EventBridge . Any value you specify in your template is ignored.

ApiKeyName.description: The name of the API key to use for authorization.

ApiKeyValue.description: The value for the API key to use for authorization.

ApiKeyAuthParameters.description: The API key authorization parameters for the connection.
The API Key parameters to use for authorization.

BasicAuthParameters.description: The authorization parameters for Basic authorization.

ConnectivityParameters.description:
For private OAuth authentication endpoints. The parameters EventBridge uses to authenticate against the endpoint.

For more information, see [Authorization methods for connections](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eventbridge/latest/userguide/eb-target-connection-auth.html) in the **Amazon EventBridge User Guide** .

InvocationHttpParameters.description: Additional parameters for the connection that are passed through with every invocation to the HTTP endpoint.

OAuthParameters.description: The OAuth parameters to use for authorization.

AuthParameters.description: Tthe authorization parameters to use for the connection.

Password.description: The password associated with the user name to use for Basic authorization.

Username.description: The user name to use for Basic authorization.

BasicAuthParameters.description: The Basic authorization parameters for the connection.

ClientID.description: The client ID to use for OAuth authorization.

ClientSecret.description: The client secret assciated with the client ID to use for OAuth authorization.

ClientParameters.description: The OAuth authorization parameters to use for the connection.

BodyParameters.description: Any additional body string parameters for the connection.

HeaderParameters.description: Any additional header parameters for the connection.

QueryStringParameters.description: Any additional query string parameters for the connection.

ConnectionHttpParameters.description: Any additional parameters for the connection.

ResourceParameters.description: The parameters for EventBridge to use when invoking the resource endpoint.

ConnectivityParameters.description:
If you specify a private OAuth endpoint, the parameters for EventBridge to use when authenticating against the endpoint.

For more information, see [Authorization methods for connections](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eventbridge/latest/userguide/eb-target-connection-auth.html) in the **Amazon EventBridge User Guide** .

AuthorizationEndpoint.description: The URL to the authorization endpoint when OAuth is specified as the authorization type.

ClientParameters.description: The client parameters for OAuth authorization.

HttpMethod.description: The method to use for the authorization request.

OAuthHttpParameters.description: Details about the additional parameters to use for the connection.

OAuthParameters.description: Contains the OAuth authorization parameters to use for the connection.

IsValueSecret.description: Specifies whether the value is secret.

Key.description: The key for a query string parameter.

Value.description: The value associated with the key for the query string parameter.

Parameter.description: Any additional query string parameter for the connection. You can include up to 100 additional query string parameters per request. Each additional parameter counts towards the event payload size, which cannot exceed 64 KB.

ResourceAssociationArn.description:
For connections to private APIs, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource association EventBridge created between the connection and the private API's resource configuration.

> The value of this property is set by EventBridge . Any value you specify in your template is ignored.

ResourceConfigurationArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon VPC Lattice resource configuration for the resource endpoint.

ResourceParameters.description: The parameters for EventBridge to use when invoking the resource endpoint.

description:
Creates a connection. A connection defines the authorization type and credentials to use for authorization with an API destination HTTP endpoint.

For more information, see [Connections for endpoint targets](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eventbridge/latest/userguide/eb-target-connection.html) in the *Amazon EventBridge User Guide* .

AuthParameters.description:
The authorization parameters to use to authorize with the endpoint.

You must include only authorization parameters for the `AuthorizationType` you specify.

AuthorizationType.description:
The type of authorization to use for the connection.

> OAUTH tokens are refreshed when a 401 or 407 response is returned.

Description.description: A description for the connection to create.

InvocationConnectivityParameters.description:
For connections to private APIs, the parameters to use for invoking the API.

For more information, see [Connecting to private APIs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eventbridge/latest/userguide/connection-private.html) in the **Amazon EventBridge User Guide** .

KmsKeyIdentifier.description:
The identifier of the AWS  customer managed key for EventBridge to use, if you choose to use a customer managed key to encrypt this connection. The identifier can be the key Amazon Resource Name (ARN), KeyId, key alias, or key alias ARN.

If you do not specify a customer managed key identifier, EventBridge uses an AWS owned key to encrypt the connection.

For more information, see [Identify and view keys](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kms/latest/developerguide/viewing-keys.html) in the *AWS Key Management Service Developer Guide* .

Name.description: The name for the connection to create.
